data.title: Fantastic Food, Friendly Service
data.text: My friends and I ate here late one evening. We were welcomed warmly even though it was close to kitchen closing time. We did not feel rushed. The server brought our food quickly and we all agreed the food was better than average. Prices are very reasonable, affordable. The place is tiny but has a big heart.

data.title: Wonderful Vegan Asian Food, Uncomfortable Experience
data.text: We had a delicious lunch here today (Vietnamese Crepe and Chicken Satay Sandwich with sweet potato fries). Our waiter was gracious, friendly and knowledgeable. However, when we came in the restaurant was uncomfortably warm. We asked our waiter if she could make it cooler and she said she couldn't - that only the owner could do that and she didn't know when the owner would arrive. So we decided to eat at one of the 2 outdoor sidewalk tables. It was also quite hot outside - but not as hot as inside - and we were constantly shooing away flies, which really detracted from our enjoyment of the food.

data.title: Damn, I thought the meat dishes were real meat.
data.text:
When most of the guests at the table are vegetarian, and you want to eat beef, chicken and pork ..... then you must either eat at or take out from Bodhi Tree. I had never heard of this restaurant and was advised by my son to order anything on the menu there.

Well, I brought a large feast home and dined like a King,  finger licking et al.

Then my son asked me ...."Dad, did you know that everything you ate,  chicken, pork, beef etc,  was vegetarian?"

I sat back and was completely overwhelmed.  I wanted to try the lot one more time,  but ALAS..........it was all gone.  I have never had a vegetarian meal that fooled me completely.  It goes without saying, that the meal was AMA.......ZING.  This is where it makes no sense to be non-vegetarian eh ?

data.title: Vegan but Bland!
data.text:
The service was poor and the food was bland. We ordered 3 different dishes and while we received it in good time, the overall experience was so disappointing based on the reviews. Since we were new to the restaurant, we tried to ask questions about the dishes and the server was uninterested in helping us figure out what was what and kept leaving while we were trying to ask questions. We just guessed and picked out some rather unremarkable dishes. I ordered the sweet and sour "chicken". The
chicken was some sort of fried balls and were tough. The sauce was neither sweet nor sour.    **The only positive was the appetizer of hummus and sweet potato fries. 
They were  the only thing that had flavor but as you can see from the picture, there was a scant dollop of hummus on the plate. (I captured the picture after only two fries were snatched up...)

data.title: Best Spring rolls in town
data.text: Spring rolls alone are worth the trip.  Fresh, not fried, vegan, with peanut sauce.  This vegetarian restaurant also has a good Sunday Buffet.   Service is good, albeit a bit slow.  Parking can be difficult as it is near the Main St in Huntington Beach and does not have it's own parking lot.  Not much on ambiance, but again, what we go for is the food.

data.title: Best Sizzling Rice Soup
data.text: It's very hard to find a great place to find good, healthy fresh soup without MSG or it's been sitting around all day.  Everything here is delicious. Very healthy, you can ask for them to cook using little oil and make it healthy.  I've come here felling a little up under the weather, the chef made me some special soup that some how made me feeling better within the hour.  Very friendly service.  You can feel the love here.  Great addition to our downtown.

data.title: Delicious Vegan Food a Walk Away from HB Pier
data.text: I was traveling with a friend that is a strict vegan and this was the perfect spot for dinner then a walk on the pier. There were so many options that we literally ordered a feast. Everything was delicious! We ordered the vietnamese crepe, egg rolls, soup, and 2 entrees. The sticky rice mango dessert is a must have. Yum!

data.title: Not just for Vegans!
data.text: Although the entire menu is vegan, I honestly believe that even a lifelong carnivore would enjoy the food here. My fave is the lemon 'chicken', potstickers & eggless egg rolls... Yummm.

data.title: one of our favorites
data.text: local, excellent food, priced very reasonable and excellent service!!! what more do you need…outdoor seating for lunch or indoor…

data.title: Good food and service for a great value.
data.text: A Vietnamese style restaurant with a large range of vegetarian options. For an appetizer I recommend the spring rolls and for the meal the hot and sour soup. So good! This is definitely one of the best places to eat in Huntington Beach. The food is very reasonably priced and tasty. I've been here multiple times and the food is great.

data.title: Great food and good service
data.text: Great food. Fresh and super tasty. the fried veggie fish was outstanding. Friendly and helpful staff. We left satisfied and will be sure to visit again.

data.title: Delicious and great value.
data.text: Had a great meal here with my wife. Food was beautiful, very reasonably priced and a large variety was on offer. Service was amazing, waiter really nice! Def be back!

data.title: The best Vietnamese vegetarian/vegan restaurant
data.text:
I love the foods at this restaurant, with the excellent flavor for vegetarian foods, the menu indicated with meat but actually they are using meat substituted 100% vegan 

Appetizer try the spring rolls or seaweed wrap, for salad try the salmon skin salad or chicken walnut salad, for dinner they have many excellent dishes I had the orange chicken, fried fish with mango salad, Lemongrass Fried Fish, Steamed Abalone w/ Shiitake Mushrooms. you must order the fresh coconut drink... enjoy

data.title: Great food!
data.text: We visited this restaurant yesterday with friends.  While the restaurant is certainly not fancy - the food was exceptional.  This is a vegetarian restaurant that on certain dishes I would challenge any one to determine hat it is not the labeled 'fish' or 'chicken' etc.  We started with the shrimp spring rolls - perfect.  This was followed by fried 'calamari' - my husband liked this dish better than real calamari.  We also had a chicken cabbage salad that was scrumptious and finally had the wonton vegetable soup.  We shared all the dishes and brought food home.  This is very economical.  The only negative was that our waitress wanted to serve the food all at once and due to a language barrier we had a hard time slowing her down.  Also, while it did not bother me, I could see where some customers might find the visiting pigeon who 'patrols' the floors annoying - I felt it was rather picturesque.  Will definitely return!

data.title: Consistently Delicious Fresh Chinese Food
data.text:
Take out from Bodhi Tree is a semi-regular thing at home, but I'd never been to the restaurant before. After visiting it once I ended up going back a couple more times with other people because the atmosphere is so nice, and the service friendly and attentive.

I'd been very curious about the "crispy duck", as I'd only ever had straight vegetarian dishes, since there are so many delicious ones to choose from (I always get the green papaya salad). The crispy duck was delicious, though I don't think it seemed much like duck. It *was* very crisp and delicious and oh-so-satisfying and there was so much there that I ended up taking home leftovers and enjoying the entire meal again that night.

data.title: The soup is still the best around
data.text: I stopped in at Bodhi Tree for lunch and ordered soup and a salad.  The won ton soup was flavorful and filling and was definitely better than anything served at nearby restaurants.  The salad was a little disappointing for me but only because the menu indicated that it included walnuts.  There were no walnuts but the dressing had a very strong taste of peanut butter.  The only way I like peanuts is whole nuts.  I've never liked dressings or sauces that taste like peanut butter.  So it was off-putting to me but if you like peanut sauce you just might have loved it.  I also tried the "chicken" flavored tofu on the salad.  I like tofu but I just can't get into tofu trying to taste like animal protein.   This place never disappoints with its soups and true vegetarian dishes (made to taste like vegetables not animal protein).   I will continue to go back but I'll be careful about my choices.

data.title: Absolutely Loved it!
data.text:
I'n not a vegetarian but I absolutely loved this place. Highly recommend.
Ana

data.title: Wow.  The food.  Wow again.
data.text:
Sizzling rice soup with chicken.  Smoked duck.  Pepper steak.  All 100% vegan.  Absolutely incredible.
I've eaten some terrific vegan food, but the Bodhi Tree Cafe produced the most amazing vegetarian dishes I've ever tasted.  My mouth is watering again just remembering.

data.title: Great tasting food! Vegetarian or not...
data.text: Great tasting food! Vegetarian or not. All the appetizers are great. Can't go wrong with the chicken pineapple stir fry. Service is sometimes slow.

data.title: Always great soup
data.text:
I work nearby so sometimes stop at Bodhi for lunch.  Their combo meals include soup and it's always really good.  On a cool day, just a bowl of the soup hits the spot.     I'm not a fan of imitation meats.  I'd rather just have vegetables that are meant to taste like vegetables so
I often order a tofu and vegetable dish.  Always very tasty.
